column1: Earth is the planet we live on. It is the third planet from the Sun. It is the only planet known to have life on it. The Earth formed around 4.5 billion years ago. It is one of four rocky planets on the inside of the Solar System. The other three are Mercury
column2: Venus and Mars.The large mass of the Sun makes the Earth move around it
column3: just as the mass of the Earth makes the Moon move around it. The Earth also turns round in space
column4: so different parts face the Sun at different times. The Earth goes around the Sun once (one "year") for every 365¼ times it turns all the way around (one "day").The Moon goes around the Earth about every 27 days. As the Earth goes round the Sun at the same time
column5: the changing light of the Moon takes about 29½ days to go from dark to bright to dark again. That is where the idea of "month" came from. However
column6: now most months have 30 or 31 days so they fit into one year.
